page.title: 19The Ringstead Railway.
page.content: The railway through Ringstead was opened on February 19th 1845.It was part of the network owned by the North Western Railway.It ran from Northampton to Peterborough .The station was at the end of Station Road, about one mile from the centre of the village,but as there were few coaches and nobody had cars the train was used by everybody who wanted to go anywhere. To make sure people were not late for the train the station master,who lived in a house by the station,rang a bell when the train was leaving Stanwick or Thrapston.The people would know they had to hurry from Ringstead,Addington or Woodford, for the station served all these villages. There were two platforms,a ticket office and a waiting room.There was also a level crossing.
